summary: This document details the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein at Teterboro Airport in New Jersey on July 6, 2019, pursuant to a federal arrest warrant. It outlines the circumstances of his arrest, including the involvement of various FBI agents and Customs and Border Protection personnel, as well as the charges against him related to sex trafficking of minors.

persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested at Teterboro Airport on charges of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy to commit sex trafficking.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested at Teterboro Airport after arriving from Paris, France, on charges of sex trafficking of minors.

events.title: Initial Appearance
events.description: Epstein was scheduled for his initial appearance in court following his arrest.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested on July 6, 2019, at Teterboro Airport.
He was charged with sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy to commit sex trafficking.
The arrest was conducted by FBI Special Agents and Task Force Officers.
Epstein was processed by Customs and Border Protection agents upon his return to the U.S.
He requested to speak with his lawyer before questioning after being informed of the arrest warrant.
